page.title: 06Monmouth-a Local History 2
page.content: There are two{churches}in Monmouth {St. Mary's}erected on the site of the original Priory Church.The church of {St.Thomas,Overmonnow}has an original Norman chancel arch and doorway. {St Michael and All Angels Church, Mitchel Troy dates from the early 13th.Century,with the tower added in 1414. The church at Wonastow is dedicated to{Saint Wonnow,}and the first church on this site was built in the 7th. century, but largely restored in the 1860's. The earliest reference to knitting referred to{"Monmouth Caps"}which have been produced in Monmouth since the 16th.century. An{oak tree}in{Wyesham}is extremely old and is a famous landmark in the area.
